009package Ch11_Circles_Ellipses;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic.EllipseFitAlgebraic.FitType.FitzgibbonStable;
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.geometric.EllipseFitGeometric.FitType.DistanceBased;
013import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
014
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import ij.IJ;
018import ij.ImagePlus;
019import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
020import ij.gui.Overlay;
021import ij.gui.Roi;
022import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
023import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
024import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.AlgebraicEllipse;
027import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
028import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic.EllipseFitAlgebraic;
029import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.geometric.EllipseFitGeometric;
030import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
031import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
032import imagingbook.common.ij.RoiUtils;
033import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
034import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
035
036/**
037 * <p>
038 * ImageJ plugin, performs algebraic ellipse fitting on the current ROI to find
039 * an initial ellipse, followed by geometric fitting. Algebraic and geometric
040 * fit methods can be selected (see Sec. 11.2 of [1] for details). If
041 * successful, the resulting ellipses are displayed as a vector overlay (color
042 * can be chosen). Sample points are either collected from the ROI (if
043 * available) or collected as foreground pixels (values &gt; 0) from the image. If
044 * no image is currently open, the user is asked to create a suitable sample
045 * image.
046 * </p>
047 * <p>
048 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
049 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
050 * </p>
051 * 
052 * @author WB
053 * @version 2022/10/03
054 *
055 */
056public class Ellipse_Fitting implements PlugInFilter {
057        
058        static EllipseFitAlgebraic.FitType AlgebraicFitMethod = FitzgibbonStable;
059        static EllipseFitGeometric.FitType GeometricFitMethod = DistanceBased;
060        static boolean UsePointsFromRoi = false;
061        
062        private static BasicAwtColor AlgebraicFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Red;
063        private static BasicAwtColor GeometricFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Blue;
064        private static double StrokeWidth = 0.5;
065        
066        private ImagePlus im;
067        
068        /**
069         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
070         * is currently open.
071         */
072        public Ellipse_Fitting() {
073                if (noCurrentImage()) {
074                        if (DialogUtils.askForSampleImage()) {
075                                IjUtils.run(new Ellipse_Make_Random()); //runPlugIn(Ellipse_Make_Random.class);
076                        }                       
077                }
078        }
079        
080        @Override
081        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
082                this.im = im;
083                return DOES_ALL;
084        }
085
086        @Override
087        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
088                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
089                UsePointsFromRoi = (roi != null);
090                
091                if (!runDialog()) {
092                        return;
093                }
094                
095                Pnt2d[] points = (UsePointsFromRoi) ?
096                                RoiUtils.getOutlinePointsFloat(roi) :
097                                IjUtils.collectNonzeroPoints(ip);
098                
099                IJ.log("Found points " + points.length);
100                if (points.length < 5) {
101                        IJ.error("At least 5 points are required, but found only " + points.length);
102                        return;
103                }
104                
105                Overlay oly = im.getOverlay();
106                if (oly == null) {
107                        oly = new Overlay();
108                        im.setOverlay(oly);
109                }
110                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly); 
111                
112                Pnt2d xref = Pnt2d.from(ip.getWidth()/2, ip.getHeight()/2);     // reference point for ellipse fitting
113                
114                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
115                EllipseFitAlgebraic fitA = EllipseFitAlgebraic.getFit(AlgebraicFitMethod, points, xref);
116                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
117                
118                AlgebraicEllipse ae = fitA.getEllipse();                
119                if (ae == null) {
120                        IJ.log("Algebraic fit: no result!");
121                        return;
122                }
123                
124                GeometricEllipse initEllipse = new GeometricEllipse(ae);
125                
126                IJ.log("Initial fit (algebraic):");
127                IJ.log("  ellipse: " + initEllipse.toString());
128                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", initEllipse.getMeanSquareError(points)));
129                
130                ColoredStroke initialStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, AlgebraicFitColor.getColor());
131                ola.addShapes(initEllipse.getShapes(3), initialStroke);
132
133                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
134                EllipseFitGeometric fitG = EllipseFitGeometric.getFit(GeometricFitMethod, points, initEllipse);
135                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
136                
137                GeometricEllipse finalEllipse = fitG.getEllipse();
138                if (finalEllipse == null) {
139                        IJ.log("Geometric fit: no result!");
140                        return;
141                }
142                
143                IJ.log("Final fit (geometric):");
144                IJ.log("  ellipse: " + finalEllipse.toString());
145                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", finalEllipse.getMeanSquareError(points)));
146                IJ.log("  iterations = " + fitG.getIterations());
147
148                ColoredStroke finalStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, GeometricFitColor.getColor());
149                ola.addShapes(finalEllipse.getShapes(3), finalStroke);
150        }
151
152        // ------------------------------------------
153        
154        private boolean runDialog() {
155                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
156                
157                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
158                                "This plugin performs algebraic + geometric ellipse fitting,",
159                                "either to ROI points (if available) or foreground points",
160                                "collected from the pixel image."
161                                ));
162                
163                gd.addCheckbox("Use ROI (float) points", UsePointsFromRoi);
164                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic fit method", AlgebraicFitMethod);
165                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic ellipse color", AlgebraicFitColor);
166                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric fit method", GeometricFitMethod);
167                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric ellipse color", GeometricFitColor);
168                
169                gd.showDialog();
170                if (gd.wasCanceled())
171                        return false;
172                
173                AlgebraicFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(EllipseFitAlgebraic.FitType.class);
174                AlgebraicFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
175                
176                GeometricFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(EllipseFitGeometric.FitType.class);
177                GeometricFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
178                
179                return true;
180        }
181
182
183
184}
